intro: Psittacanthus teretiflorus, commonly known as the narrow-flowered sterculia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
